intro: Campylobotrys pyrophylla, commonly known as the flame lily, is a unique flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers, which resemble small flames, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soil and full sun. The foliage consists of strap-shaped leaves that are often green or variegated, adding to its visual appeal.
